content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!--  <!DOCTYPE metadata SYSTEM "metadata.dtd">  --> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Minnesota Pollution Control Agency</origin> <pubdate>20040605</pubdate> <title>Minnesota Impaired Lakes, 2004</title> <mgmg1cid></mgmg1cid> <pubinfo> <publish>Minnesota Pollution Control Agency</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://www.pca.state.mn.us/publications/maps/tmdl-04.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>These are the impaired lakes as determined by MPCA in 2004. The lakes are a subset and enhancement of the 1:100,000 scale National Hydrography Dataset (NHD). MPCA adds additional lakes.  Since the impaired lakes are a small subset of the NHD lakes, only that subset is included in the dataset.</abstract> <purpose>The data set was created as part of the Minnesota Pollution Control Agency's Environmental Data Access System, which allows for public access to surface water monitoring data.</purpose> <supplinf>State of Minnesota</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>2004</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>May 13, 2004</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Biennial</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-97.141585</westbc> <eastbc>-89.904789</eastbc> <northbc>49.404382</northbc> <southbc>43.449042</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>environment, monitoring, surface water, water chemistry, water quality, impaired waters, TMDL, 303(d), mercury, PCB, fish consumption, fecal coliform, dieldrin, DDT, dioxin, toxaphene, low oxygen, temperature, turbidity, TSS, ammonia, impaired biota, chloride</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekey>Minnesota</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>By acceptance of this data, the user agrees not to transmit this data or provide access to it or any part of it in digital form to another party or individual.  Users may make and distribute maps.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Howard Markus</cntper> <cntorg>Minnesota Pollution Control Agency</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Senior Engineer, Environmental Outcomes Division</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>520 Lafayette Road</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>MN</state> <postal>55155</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-296-7295</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-297-8324</cntfax> <cntemail>howard.markus@state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen>None available</browsen> <browsed></browsed> </browse> <native>Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800</native> <crossref> <citeinfo> <title>Minnesota Impaired Streams, 2004</title> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>Attributes are believed to be accurate</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>The data is topoligically 'clean'</logic> <complete>The data set contains all impaired lakes contained in the 2004 Final 303(d) List of Impaired Waters, approved by U.S. EPA on May 13, 2004.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar></horizpar> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr></vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srcscale>100000</srcscale> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>This dataset was created using the Reach Indexing Tool (RIT) to create polygon event themes which contain the MN Dept. of Natural Resources (DNR) Lake identifier .  The event themes were merged into a statewide polygon shapefile.  An Excel spreadsheet containing the 2004 Final 303(d) List of Impaired Waters, approved by U.S. EPA on May 13, 2004 was converted to a lookup table.  Each row of the table contained the Lake ID as well as pollutant/stressor attributes.  The table was joined to the statewide polygon shapefile on the Lake ID.  A shapefile was exported from ArcView 3.2x. for only those polygons with a match in the 2004 303(d) lookup table.  The shapefile was imported as an SDE feature class for use in the Environmental Data Access application.</procdesc> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <indspref></indspref> <direct>Vector</direct> <mgmg3obj>Polygon</mgmg3obj> <mgmg3til></mgmg3til> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres></latres> <longres></longres> </geograph> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn></mapprojn> <mgmg4par></mgmg4par> <otherprj></otherprj> </mapproj> <gridsys> <gridsysn>UTM</gridsysn> <utm> <utmzone>15</utmzone> </utm> <spcs> <spcszone></spcszone> </spcs> <mgmg4coz></mgmg4coz> <mgmg4adj></mgmg4adj> </gridsys> <planci> <coordrep> <absres></absres> <ordres></ordres> </coordrep> <distbrep> <distres></distres> </distbrep> <plandu>Meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>NAD83</horizdn> <ellips>GRS80</ellips> </geodetic> </horizsys> <vertdef> <altsys> <altdatum></altdatum> <altunits></altunits> </altsys> <depthsys> <depthdn></depthdn> <depthdu></depthdu> </depthsys> </vertdef> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>All lakes contained in this shapefile are considered to be impaired by the MPCA.</eaover> <eadetcit>AUID = Assessment Unit ID is  the MN Department of Natural Resources Public Waters Inventory number which is formatted CC-LLLL-BB.  CC is the two digit county number, LLLL is the four digit lake number (unique within county) and BB is the two digit bay number (00 if the id represents the entire lake).  ENTITY_ID = A Waterbody Identifier that is the two letter state abbreviation MN concatenated with the AUID.  This ID format is transmitted to EPA for reporting purposes.  ACRES = MN Department of Natural Resources Bulletin 25 lake size in acres  NUTRIENTS = Values: Nutrients = lake is impaired by excess nutrients  BAT = Values: M = lake has a mercury fish consumption advisory                         P = lake has a PCB fish consumption advisory                         M, P = lake has both a mercury and PCB fish consumption advisory  IMPAIRED_U = Impaired Use                          Values: Aquatic Consumption                                       Aquatic Recreation                                       Aquatic Consumption and Aquatic Recreation  DOW_NAME = MN Department of Natural Resources Public Waters Inventory lake name  CATEGORY = EPA\ufffd\ufffds Consolidation Assessment and Listing Methodology [CALM] integrates the 305(b) Report with the 303(d) TMDL List  The five categories in CALM are as follows: Category 1: all designated uses are meeting water quality standards Category 2: some uses are meeting water quality standards and there are insufficient data to assess other uses Category 3: there are insufficient data to assess any uses Category 4: at least one use is impaired, but a TMDL is not required Category 5: at least one use is impaired and a TMDL is required.  These become the List of impaired waters.  A  reach can only be placed into one Category.  For example, if a reach is impaired for one pollutant but the other uses are being met, and a TMDL is required, that reach would be placed into Category 5.  Furthermore, if the reach is impaired for more than one pollutant, the reach must stay in Category 5 until ALL pollutants have EPA-approved TMDL plans.  For 'bookkeeping' purposes, these Categories can be sub-divided.  Category 4 has the following four sub-categories: 4A: Impaired, but a TMDL study has been approved by EPA 4B: Impaired, but a TMDL study is not required because water quality standards are expected to be met in the near future 4C: Impaired, but a TMDL study is not required because the impairment is not caused by a pollutant 4D: An assessment unit is impaired or threatened but doesn't require a TMDL because the impairment is due to natural conditions with only insignificant anthropogenic influence.  To be considered \ufffd\ufffdinsignificant\ufffd\ufffd, the elimination of the anthropogenic influence would not lead to the attainment of water quality standards and it would not be included in formal pollution reduction goal-setting activities.  A reach-specific water quality standard based on local natural conditions has yet to be determined. Upon determination, the assessment unit will be considered non-impaired for the natural conditions and re-categorized to an appropriate category.  Category 5 has the following three sub-categories: 5A: Impaired by multiple pollutants and no TMDL study plans are approved by EPA 5B: Impaired by multiple pollutants and at least one TMDL study plan is approved by EPA 5C: Impaired by one pollutant and no TMDL study plan is approved by EPA</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Carrie Bartz</cntper> <cntorg>Minnesota Pollution Control Agency</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Information Technology Specialist</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>520 Lafayette Road</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>MN</state> <postal>55155</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-296-9323</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-282-5446</cntfax> <cntemail>carrie.bartz@state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>Downloadable Data</resdesc> <distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, the GIS Data must include a copy of this disclaimer.</distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>Shapefile</formname> <formvern>3.x and 8.x</formvern> <transize></transize> </digtinfo> </digform> <ordering>Downloadable in shapefile format from the Minnesota Pollution Control Agency's web site.  See web address in the Online Linkage section below.</ordering> </stdorder> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20070521</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Beth Oman</cntper> <cntorg>Minnesota Pollution Control Agency</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>520 Lafayette Road</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>MN</state> <postal>55155</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-296-8861</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-282-5446</cntfax> <cntemail>beth.oman@state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn> <metstdv>1.2</metstdv> <metextns> <onlink>http://www.lmic.state.mn.us/gc/stds/metadata.htm</onlink> </metextns> </metainfo> </metadata>
